Detailed Description

Author: Jaakko Luttinen Body is a class for all the bodies in the world. All bodies are considered as circle shaped. Bodies can have mass and they can emit gravitational field. Body is always in some world and it cannot be changed. World will clean the memory allocation of the body. Body has a visualization.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Body::Body (  World &  world,
float  x,
float  y,
float  radius,
float  mass,
bool  emitGravitation,
bool  collidable
) 
 

Constructs a new body.

Parameters:
world The world which the body will be put into. Note, constructor does NOT add the body into the world automatically.
x X-coordinate of the body's center in the world.
y Y-coordinate of the body's center in the world.
radius The radius of the body.
mass The mass of the body.
emitGravitation Tells whether body emits gravitational field.
collidable Tells whether body is collidable.

Destructs the body.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void Body::collide (  Body &  collidingBody  )  [inline, virtual]
 

When two bodies collide (determined by collisionDetection function) their collide functions are called to simulate the collision.

Parameters:
collidingBody The other body in collision.

Reimplemented in BodyMovable, and BodyProjectile.

bool Body::collisionDetection (  Body &  testBody  )  const
 

Tells whether the body and given body collide. Two bodies will collide if all the following circumstances are met: 1) Bodies are in the same world. 2) At least one of the bodies is collidable. 3) None of the bodies is destroyed. 4) The circles of the bodies collide in the world.

Parameters:
testBody The body to determine the collision with.
Returns:
Tells whether the bodies collide.

virtual void Body::destroy (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Body cannot remove itself from the world, so it must raise a flag which will be read by the world. World then removes the body and frees body's memory allocation.

Reimplemented in BodyPlanet.

void Body::draw (  Graphics &  graphics  )  [virtual]
 

Visualizes the body to the given graphics system.

Parameters:
graphics The graphics system.

Reimplemented in BodyCannon, BodyDebris, BodyExplosion, BodyPlanet, and BodyProjectile.

bool Body::emitsGravitation (   )  [inline]
 

Tells whether the body emits gravitational field.

Returns:
Tells whether the body emits gravitational field.

virtual void Body::endOfRound (  float  step  )  [inline, virtual]
 

This function will be called after a round in game. Body may do its procedures.

Parameters:
step The step length (0-1). This function may called many times to make simulation fluent. For example, four calls with parameters 0.2, 0.2, 0.3 and 0.3 will make a whole 1.0 end of round.

Reimplemented in BodyPlanet.

virtual float Body::getPhase (   )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Tells the phase of the body (0-1). What the phase exactly tells, is undefined and may be used differently by subclasses. Phase will be used in drawing the sprite.

Returns:
The phase of the body (0-1).

Reimplemented in BodyMovable, and BodyProjectile.

void Body::setActionFlag (  bool  action  )  [inline]
 

Game engine may use action flag to determine whether the body is an action body and should be waited to finish its action. After all action bodies are destroyed the game itself will continue.

Parameters:
action Tells whether the body is an action body.

void Body::setCollidable (  bool  collidable  )  [inline]
 

Two bodies may collide only if the other or both bodies are collidable. No collision will occur if both are non-collidable.

Parameters:
collidable Tells whether the body is collidable.

void Body::setLocation (  float  x,
float  y
)  [inline]
 

Sets the location of the body.

Parameters:
x X-coordinate.
y Y-coordinate.

void Body::setMass (  float  mass  )  [inline]
 

Sets the mass of the body. If mass is zero, no gravitational field will affect the body.

Parameters:
mass The mass of the body.

void Body::setRadius (  float  radius  )  [inline]
 

Sets the radius of the body.

Parameters:
radius The radius of the body.

virtual void Body::step (  unsigned int  timestep  )  [inline, virtual]
 

This function will be called with short delays to simulate the body in the world.

Parameters:
timestep Delay since last call in milliseconds.

Reimplemented in BodyExplosion, BodyMovable, and BodyProjectile.
